author: Liz Hoffman
title: Goldman Sachs Profit Jumped 26% in First Quarter
text:
Goldman Sachs Group Inc. reported sharply higher profit and revenue from a year ago, catching the wave of lower taxes and newly active markets that boosted other big banks’ quarterly earnings.
First-quarter revenue at the Wall Street firm rose 25% from a year ago to $10.04 billion. Profits of $2.83 billion, or $6.95 a share, were up 26%. Both figures beat analyst expectations.
